trans-unit.source: Title text of the Dialog GUI.

seg-source.mrk: Title text of the Dialog GUI.

target.mrk: Title text of the Dialog GUI.

trans-unit.source: Initial directory selected in the GUI file tree.

seg-source.mrk: Initial directory selected in the GUI file tree.

target.mrk: Initial directory selected in the GUI file tree.

trans-unit.source: File type single filter such as "All (*.*)" or "Text files (*.txt)" or multiple filter groups such as "All (*.*)|Text files (*.txt)" (See Remarks).

seg-source.mrk: File type single filter such as "All (*.*)" or "Text files (*.txt)" or multiple filter groups such as "All (*.*)|Text files (*.txt)" (See Remarks).

target.mrk: File type single filter such as "All (*.*)" or "Text files (*.txt)" or multiple filter groups such as "All (*.*)|Text files (*.txt)" (See Remarks).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Dialog Options: To use more than one option, BitOR the required values together.

seg-source.mrk: To use more than one option, BitOR the required values together.

target.mrk: To use more than one option, BitOR the required values together.

trans-unit.source: $FD_PATHMUSTEXIST (2) = Path Must Exist (if user types a path, ending with a backslash)

seg-source.mrk: $FD_PATHMUSTEXIST (2) = Path Must Exist (if user types a path, ending with a backslash)

target.mrk: $FD_PATHMUSTEXIST (2) = Path Must Exist (if user types a path, ending with a backslash)

trans-unit.source: [optional] File name to suggest to the user to save the file with. Default is blank ("").

seg-source.mrk: File name to suggest to the user to save the file with.

target.mrk: File name to suggest to the user to save the file with.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

seg-source.mrk: The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

target.mrk: The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

trans-unit.source: the full path of the file chosen. Results for multiple selections are "Directory|file1|file2|..."

seg-source.mrk: the full path of the file chosen.

target.mrk: the full path of the file chosen.

trans-unit.source: Separate the file filters with a semicolon as shown in the example.

seg-source.mrk: Separate the file filters with a semicolon as shown in the example.

target.mrk: Separate the file filters with a semicolon as shown in the example.

trans-unit.source: Multiple groups of filters are separated by a pipe "|".

seg-source.mrk: Multiple groups of filters are separated by a pipe "|".

target.mrk: Multiple groups of filters are separated by a pipe "|".

trans-unit.source: If default name is given, options must also be given. If none of the options are wanted, use 0 for options.

seg-source.mrk: If default name is given, options must also be given.
If none of the options are wanted, use 0 for options.

target.mrk: If default name is given, options must also be given.
If none of the options are wanted, use 0 for options.

trans-unit.source: Special Windows folders (such as "My Documents") can be set as root by using the right CLSID detailed in the Appendix.

seg-source.mrk: Special Windows folders (such as "My Documents") can be set as root by using the right CLSID detailed in the Appendix.

target.mrk: Special Windows folders (such as "My Documents") can be set as root by using the right CLSID detailed in the Appendix.

trans-unit.source: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the message to display in FileSaveDialog.

seg-source.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the message to display in FileSaveDialog.

target.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the message to display in FileSaveDialog.

trans-unit.source: Display a save dialog to select a file.

seg-source.mrk: Display a save dialog to select a file.

target.mrk: Display a save dialog to select a file.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the filename from the filepath e.g. Example.au3.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve the filename from the filepath e.g.

target.mrk: Retrieve the filename from the filepath e.g.

trans-unit.source: Check if the extension .au3 is appended to the end of the filename.

seg-source.mrk: Check if the extension .au3 is appended to the end of the filename.

target.mrk: Check if the extension .au3 is appended to the end of the filename.

trans-unit.source: If a period (dot) is found then check whether or not the extension is equal to .au3.

seg-source.mrk: If a period (dot) is found then check whether or not the extension is equal to .au3.

target.mrk: If a period (dot) is found then check whether or not the extension is equal to .au3.

trans-unit.source: If the extension isn't equal to .au3 then append to the end of the filepath.

seg-source.mrk: If the extension isn't equal to .au3 then append to the end of the filepath.

target.mrk: If the extension isn't equal to .au3 then append to the end of the filepath.

trans-unit.source: If no period (dot) was found then append to the end of the file.

seg-source.mrk: If no period (dot) was found then append to the end of the file.

target.mrk: If no period (dot) was found then append to the end of the file.
